programmes.show_description: Conviction Part 1: The team investigates the death of a medical student who was suspected of having links to terrorist organisations.
Disturbing the Peace: When Mr McKay leaves Slade prison, everyone is happy - until his replacement arrives. Contains outdated language.
Sweet Smell of Success: Sitcom with Chigwell's most famous sisters. In an effort to raise some cash, Tracey thinks about selling Darryl's old car. Sharon becomes a saleswoman.
Better Times Are Coming: Tensions run high and friendships are tested on election day, when Maguire takes the law into his own hands and Corcoran must make a difficult decision.
Shopping from Home.
Shopping from Home.
Muesli: Drop in for a cuppa with the Essex sisters. Tracey decides to experience Darryl's ordeal behind bars by creating her own prison in the attic, with Sharon as her cellmate.
Trade Off: Beech pulls rank when Glaze arrests one of his informants, and they agree on a deal which Glaze lives to regret.
New. An Exercise in Truth: Nick helps a young gymnast who is struggling to keep a secret. Eva leaves hospital as George and Bracken return home.
New. Family Secrets: Jimmi and Eva struggle to talk about the miscarriage. Melody annoys Archie by offering his help in finding Daniel a car, as Joe becomes curious about his nephew's dates.
The Buck Stops Here: Zubin comes under fire for Tom's flouting of the rules, Ric refuses to accept advice and Jess finds herself alone with her memories of Nic.
The Lesser Good: Jordan prepares to report Robert's drug trial to the authorities, while Adam teeters on the brink as he is goaded by a prisoner who murdered his family.
Trade Off: Beech pulls rank when Glaze arrests one of his informants, and they agree on a deal which Glaze lives to regret.
New. As Zainab digs dirt on the Beales, Stacey and Bradley's big secret comes out and Billy gets called to a solicitor's office.
New. Jean keeps her mouth shut about the secret, but can Bradley? Meanwhile, Ian's wickedness is revealed to Jane, Peggy does some digging on Glenda and Whitney plays matchmaker.
Home and Away: Tears and laughter at the 1930s country practice that caters for the real animals in the community. James upsets the greyhound owners at the local dogtrack.
Ken reassures Sarah that he needs her. Jan and Tom spend a day reminiscing at sea.
Outrageous Fortune: When a pampered dog runs away from a life of luxury, Frank and Lu are asked to track it down.
No Peace for the Wicked: The inmates of Slade Prison get a break at the weekend to pursue their hobbies. Includes outdated language.
A Pick-Up of the Later Ming Dynasty: Long-running sitcom. Truly, Clegg and Billy find their skills are needed to help Tom and Smiler locate the source of a squeak on their handcart.
The Secret Birthday of Norman Clegg: More misadventures with those young-at-heart Yorkshire pensioners. Keen to enjoy a quiet birthday, Clegg plans a discreet lunch at a nice hotel.
In Which Gavin Hinchcliffe Loses the Gulf Stream: The record-breaking sitcom - it's been going strong since 1973! The gang are surprised to see an old pal skiing on a van roof.
The Offer: Molly Stratton asks Pearl for help when she receives anonymous threats after inheriting a beloved local pub and putting it up for sale to the highest bidder.
The Gumshoe and the Femme Fatale: After changing her will to leave everything to her housekeeper, an aging actress is attacked. Mike and Pearl clash over who they believe is responsible.
What you can't teach an old dog, obviously. An episode from the first series as James Bolam, Dennis Waterman and experienced detective friends probe a case of art forgery.
Outrageous Fortune: When a pampered dog runs away from a life of luxury, Frank and Lu are asked to track it down.
Conviction Part 2: Forensic information suggests Karl Barclay fell to his death from an aeroplane, and Sarah realises Boyd could be the only person able to redeem her.
No Peace for the Wicked: The inmates of Slade Prison get a break at the weekend to pursue their hobbies. Includes outdated language.
Muesli: Drop in for a cuppa with the Essex sisters. Tracey decides to experience Darryl's ordeal behind bars by creating her own prison in the attic, with Sharon as her cellmate.
A Day To Give Thanks: Corcoran finds himself in an ungracious state on Thanksgiving Day. Recent murders and a shocking discovery have shaken him.
Shopping from Home.
Shopping from Home.
Keep Off the Grass: The classic Essex girls sitcom. Tracey and Sharon are faced with a moral dilemma when they witness the getaway of a criminal they know after a hold-up.
Treading Water: An unhappy Jim Carver is offered a ticket out of Sun Hill - but will he take it?
New. Fears, Feats and the Frooms: What secret does the funeral parlour hold and why is Melody so freaked? Jimmi and Eva discuss the future.
New. The Party's Over: George refuses to perform a drug test for a medical student who has taken a sample of her mother's blood, fearing she may have turned to narcotics.
Forgive and Forget: Mubbs and Rosie are reconciled, but events turn nasty when Sami forgets to pick the kids up from school. Nina's taken to hospital, and there's sad news from the prison.
Die and Let Live: Jay is terrified by Jordan's news about the drug trial but his fear makes him realise how much he loves Ruth. Charlie again threatens to wash his hands of Shona.
Treading Water: An unhappy Jim Carver is offered a ticket out of Sun Hill - but will he take it?
New. It's the day of Archie's will reading, and the question on everyone's lips is who will get the Vic? Bianca and Ricky set the date for the wedding.
New. The new owner of the Vic is revealed - but who is it? Meanwhile Max and Bradley decide to go into business together and Ian and Jane are blackmailed.
Alarms and Excursions: Doctors at work in the Dales, specialising in our animal friends. Siegfried is determined to find out who is responsible for an outbreak of poisoning.
Frere questions Gerald about Hitoshi Serozawa, whose father was ruined by Sir Edward.
The Play's the Thing: When a role-playing battle in the woods goes wrong, Lu and Frank must clear the Queen's name and catch the culprit.
Happy Release: A broken ankle provides Fletcher with a spell in the prison hospital, along with a fellow patient (David Jason) who mentions a hidden eight grand. Classic laughs.
The Miraculous Curing of Old Goff Helliwell: Young-at-heart sitcom. Clegg, Truly and Billy look for something, or someone, that will put the spark back into an ailing friend's life.
The Frenchies Are Coming: Roy Clarke's young-at-heart sitcom. Just when Barry finds himself looking for an alternative to golf, Billy turns up with an archery training course.
The Man Who Invented Yorkshire Funny Stuff: The sitcom that's been going strong since 1973. Marina has bought Howard a full-size life-like gorilla. Getting it home causes mayhem.
Death Comes To Marlow Part 1: A wealthy baronet dies alone in his study the day before his wedding and Judith, Becks and Suzie find themselves at the centre of another mystery.
Death Comes To Marlow Part 2: As the suspects' alibis stack up, Judith, Becks and Suzie are pushed to their limits. Can they solve the murder before anyone else gets hurt?
Dennis Waterman stars as the seasoned cop team investigate the murder of a young peace protester, killed near a nuclear base in 1984. Are they about to expose a cover-up?
The Play's the Thing: When a role-playing battle in the woods goes wrong, Lu and Frank must clear the Queen's name and catch the culprit.
